intro: Lespedeza buergeri var. praecox, commonly known as early lespedeza, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, branching stems covered in small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink to red, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Lespedeza buergeri var. praecox is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
